bibl.title: Hazzard v. Aguirre and Price. Memo from Petitioner
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: That all the proceedings of the said Governor of the territory of Washington in the issue of the said pretended warrant for the apprehension of your petitioner are without jurisdiction in the said Governor, and in violation of the laws of the United States and of this territory and that the said pretended warrant of the said Governor was and is wholly void and of no effect whatever, and affords no authority or justification in law to the said M. H. Aguirre and the said James H. Price for the detention and restraint of your petitioner at the place aforesaid.

And your petitioner further shows into your Honor that unless the Writ of Habeas Corpus which is herein after prayed for be issued at once, your petitioner will be conveyed beyond the reach of the process of this Court or of the Courts of this Territory

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus in accordance with the Statute in such case made and provided be forthwith issued, directed to the said M.H. Aguirre and James H. Price, requiring them to have and produce the body of your petitioner before your Honor at such time and place as your Honor may by said writ direct, to do and receive what shall be ordered concerning him, and that they make due return of said writ as required by law and your petitioner will even pray etc.
